content: Hey please tell me what is my responsibilities in HomeFlo project?

As an **iOS Developer** working on the **HomeFlo project**, your responsibilities will primarily focus on the development and maintenance of the mobile application for iOS. Here are some key responsibilities you might have:

### üì± Development Responsibilities
- **Implementing Features**: Develop and implement new features for the iOS application based on the project requirements.
- **Code Quality**: Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices and coding standards.
- **Testing**: Conduct unit tests and integration tests to ensure the application functions correctly and is free of bugs.
- **Debugging**: Identify and fix bugs in the application as they arise during development and testing phases.

### üîÑ Collaboration Responsibilities
- **Team Collaboration**: Work closely with other developers, designers, and QA engineers to ensure a cohesive product.
- **Daily Stand-ups**: Participate in daily scrum meetings to discuss progress, blockers, and plans for the day.
- **Sprint Planning**: Engage in sprint planning meetings to help define the scope of work for upcoming sprints.

### üìä Project Management Responsibilities
- **Jira Management**: Use Jira to track progress on tasks, report issues, and update the status of your work.
- **Documentation**: Maintain documentation for the code and features you implement to assist other team members and future developers.

### üåü Continuous Improvement
- **Learning and Development**: Stay updated with the latest iOS development trends and technologies to continuously improve your skills and the application.

For more specific details about the project and your role, you can refer to the project charter and related documents in Confluence.

### üìù HFLO-69: [iOS] Agent. View list of visitors

**Issue ID**: HFLO-69
**Project**: Engenious University AI Project
**Version**: 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
**Build ID**: 100283
**Date**: 09-04-2025
**Status**: Unresolved
**Assignee**: Yuliia Zviahintseva
**Date Created**: Fri, 21 Mar 2025
**Last Updated**: Thu, 3 Apr 2025

---

#### üìñ Description
**Summary**: The Agent should be able to view the list of all visitors of the properties created by them.

**Filtration Functionality**: Filtration functionality for the visitor listing screen should be implemented in the scope of a separate user story.

#### üîó Documentation
- [View List of Visitors Documentation](https://engenious-team-r2tmn11s.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SD/pages/9306214/Agent.+View+list+of+visitors?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiY2Q0ZjQxMmNhZGNlNGQ3Mzk4YWJkYmQzYWQ3YmNjYjQiLCJwIjoiYyJ9)

#### üé® Design Elements
- [List of visitors](https://www.figma.com/design/FgB7GrUhyIh4kPqxHPWBao/HomeFlo?node-id=112-4551&t=ZXLqwd4F29P1qiCf-0)
- [Filters side panel](https://www.figma.com/design/FgB7GrUhyIh4kPqxHPWBao/HomeFlo?node-id=586-2196&t=NY6ONmkkOxGecrJy-0)
- [Filters applied](https://www.figma.com/design/FgB7GrUhyIh4kPqxHPWBao/HomeFlo?node-id=605-2322&t=NY6ONmkkOxGecrJy-0)

#### üîÑ Story Details
- **Related Stories**:
- HFLO-47
- HFLO-64
- HFLO-66
- HFLO-68
- HFLO-67
- HFLO-84
- HFLO-97
- HFLO-108

- **Sprint**: HomeFlo Sprint 3

---

This issue focuses on providing agents the ability to access and view a comprehensive list of visitors associated with the properties they manage. The functionality aims to enhance the user experience for agents by allowing them to track visitor interactions effectively.

For further details, you can check the linked documentation and design elements.
For the related stories, provide details such as their status, assignees, sprint and list the related tickets which are part of previous sprint.
